poem:
**Retribution and Rallies**

In the clamor  
of flags unfurled,  
vulgar whispers spiral—  
a garbage can for dreams,  
words tumble—sharp,  
a kind of bitter music  
on a turbulent stage;  
yet, in this dark  
rehearsal of revenge,  
clouds cast shadows  
as tender as rain—  
fragile echoes  
grasp for light.
